intro: Picea polita f. rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered white spruce, is a rare and ornamental variant of the white spruce. It is characterized by its striking reddish-pink cones, which contrast with its dark green needles. This form is typically found in high-altitude regions of western North America, where it thrives in cool, moist climates. The plant has a conical shape with dense foliage, making it a desirable specimen for botanical gardens. Its unique floral display makes it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
